Pecinta Alam Sarankan Pendakian ke Rinjani Dihentikan Sementara
02 Nov 2019, 03:17 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komunitas pencinta alam dan lingkungan Blue Green Indonesia menyarankan Balai Taman Nasional Gunung Rinjani sementara menyetop kegiatan pendakian Gunung Rinjani di Pulau Lombok, Nusa Tenggara Barat, sampai kondisi kawasan konservasi tersebut pulih.
"Kondisi Gunung Rinjani sebenarnya belum bisa dikatakan pulih, karena jalur pendakian masih rusak parah akibat gempa bumi pada 2018 dan kebakaran hutan beberapa waktu lalu," kata Ketua Umum Blue Green Indonesia Dian Sandi Utama dalam siaran pers komunitas yang diterima di Mataram, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Blue Green Indonesia, menurut dia, menyampaikan saran penghentian sementara aktivitas pendakian Gunung Rinjani berdasarkan beberapa pertimbangan, termasuk kondisi jalur pendakian Rinjani yang masih memprihatinkan setelah beberapa kejadian bencana alam.
"Itulah sebabnya, kami meminta aktivitas pendakian dihentikan dulu sementara waktu," kata Dian.
Kawasan Taman Nasional Gunung Rinjani, ia mengatakan, mestinya masuk tahap pemulihan menjelang datangnya musim penghujan.
"Beberapa minggu ke depan itu sebenarnya waktu yang tepat untuk program pemulihan, seperti reboisasi dan perbaikan jalur-jalur pendakian," katanya.
Ia menambahkan kerusakan kawasan gunung akibat bencana alam membutuhkan waktu untuk pulih dan kegiatan pendakian pada waktu yang tidak tepat bisa mengganggu proses pemulihan kawasan.
"Ingat juga, Gunung Rinjani itu kawasan konservasi. Jangan melihat dari sudut pandang sebagai objek wisata semata," katanya.
Balai Taman Nasional Gunung Rinjani (BTNGR) bersama TNI-Polri dan pelaku wisata melakukan pendakian Gunung Rinjani dari 1 sampai 4 November 2019 untuk memastikan jalur pendakian aman bagi pengunjung dan tidak ada lagi titik api di kawasan konservasi tersebut.
Kepala BTNGR Dedy Asriady menjelaskan, pengecekan tersebut penting dilakukan untuk memastikan keamanan jalur pendakian menyusul kebakaran di kawasan hutan Taman Nasional Gunung Rinjani selama beberapa hari sejak Sabtu (19/10) yang memicu penutupan seluruh jalur pendakian sejak 20 Oktober 2019 hingga batas waktu yang tidak ditentukan.
Dedy mengatakan bahwa hasil survei jalur pendakian Gunung Rinjani akan dibahas dan dijadikan sebagai masukan dalam membuat keputusan bersama mengenai pembukaan kembali jalur pendakian.
"Jika memungkinkan maka jalur pendakian akan dibuka pada Selasa (5/11), namun tetap terbatas hanya sampai di Pelawangan dan tidak boleh sampai ke Danau Segara Anak. Bisa juga sampai ke puncak Rinjani, tapi tidak boleh juga ke danau," kata Dedy.

Nature Lovers Suggest Ascent To Rinjani Temporarily Stopped
02 Nov 2019, 03:17 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Blue Green Indonesia community of nature and environment lovers recommends the Gunung Rinjani National Park Office while stopping the climbing activities of Mount Rinjani on the island of Lombok, West Nusa Tenggara, until the condition of the conservation area is restored.
"The actual condition of Mount Rinjani cannot be said to be recovering, because the hiking trail was still badly damaged by the earthquake in 2018 and forest fires some time ago," Blue Green Indonesia's Chairperson Dian Sandi Utama said in a community press release received in Mataram on Friday, 1 November 2019.
Blue Green Indonesia, according to him, suggested a temporary halt in the climbing activities of Mount Rinjani based on several considerations, including the condition of the Rinjani climbing trail which was still concerning after several natural disasters.
"That is why, we ask that hiking activities be stopped for a while," Dian said.
The Mount Rinjani National Park area, he said, should be included in the recovery phase before the arrival of the rainy season.
"The next few weeks are actually the right time for recovery programs, such as reforestation and improvement of hiking trails," he said.
He added that damage to the mountain area due to natural disasters requires time to recover and climbing activities at the wrong time can disrupt the process of restoring the area.
"Remember also, Mount Rinjani is a conservation area. Don't look at it from a mere tourism point of view," he said.
The Gunung Rinjani National Park Office (BTNGR) together with the Indonesian National Armed Forces (TNI) and the National Police and tour operators climbed Mount Rinjani from 1 to 4 November 2019 to ensure the hiking trail was safe for visitors and there were no more hotspots in the conservation area.
BTNGR Head Dedy Asriady explained that the check was important to ensure the safety of the hiking trail following a fire in the forest area of Mount Rinjani National Park for several days since Saturday (19/10) which triggered the closure of all hiking trails from 20 October 2019 to an unspecified deadline .
Dedy said that the results of the Mount Rinjani hiking trail survey will be discussed and used as input in making a joint decision regarding the reopening of the hiking trail.
"If possible, the hiking trail will be opened on Tuesday (5/11), but it is still limited to Pelawangan and may not reach Lake Segara Anak. It can also reach the summit of Rinjani, but not to the lake," said Dedy.
